column4:
After a historic recession, our economy experienced the largest economic growth ever recorded in American history this quarter. 

Sound economic policy and common-sense COVID-19 preventative measures will ensure that the U.S. continues to bounce back. 
https://t.co/cLR5Dc17lF

All mothers deserve access to quality maternal health care, which is why I am calling for #BlanketChange to put moms and babies first. 

To learn more about improving and expanding access to maternal health care, visit https://t.co/Y2HbMeuRAa.

It is time for Congress to put politics aside and come together to deliver #COVID19 relief.
 
The American people deserve an effective, bipartisan solution that serves the needs of our communities.

Tomorrow at 4PM, Georgia's Under Secretary for Benefits is hosting a tele-Town Hall for #Veterans and their families. The discussion will cover the VA's COVID-19 response, the Blue Water Navy Act, and the Solid Start program. 

Veterans, I encourage you to tune in at 833-380-0417

I appreciate the efforts of our leaders at @ATLairport to ensure the world’s busiest airport is as safe as possible for travelers during the continued public health emergency, as well as their commitment to engaging with the public. Read more below. 

https://t.co/YazR0LuWiO

L’shanah tovah u’metukah! 

I want to extend my wishes for a happy and healthy new year to all celebrating Rosh Hashanah this weekend. As we move from 5780 to 5781, I hope this High Holiday season brings a special sense of joy and renewal to you and your family. https://t.co/ZfWhgNtO7O

Today, the @ModernizeCmte passed a series of recommendations to ensure that Congress can continue to serve the American people through the duration of this pandemic and during future emergencies. I was proud to support this bipartisan initiative. 

https://t.co/9c1b4LMRG7

Today, as Americans joyfully celebrate #Juneteenth, the world community is drawing awareness to the fight against Sickle Cell Disease, which disproportionately affects people of African and Caribbean descent. Click below to learn more:
https://t.co/alrTZCp4vu

America’s leaders – from the President and Congress to city councils – are carefully examining additional pandemic response solutions. Click below for the latest from Capitol Hill:
https://t.co/w1Ka9vpg30

Gwinnett County will be hosting a drive-thru farmer’s market this Wednesday from 3 – 7 pm at Coolray Field in Lawrenceville. This is an incredible opportunity to support our local farmers and buy fresh, healthy food. Click below to learn more:
https://t.co/mEOfOc3hX9

Today, the House passed the HEROES Act – a 1,800 page, $3 trillion bill that doesn’t have a chance of ever becoming law. I’m disappointed that my colleagues across the aisle failed to set aside their partisan agenda and address the real issues surrounding this pandemic.

Yesterday in Rules Committee, I offered an amendment to allow the House to pass the emergency, Covid-related parts of the 1,800 bill and leave the liberal wish-list items where they belong; in another bill at another time. This amendment was defeated by every Democrat. @HouseGOP https://t.co/Yg6GHYzh5J

Amidst increased testing and a gradual, managed reopening of local businesses, Georgia has experienced a declining trend of new cases and deaths in the past 14 days. I’m proud of @GovKemp for making Georgia’s reopening a model for other states to follow.
https://t.co/bbmMBNI83r

Forsyth County Emergency Management and Georgia Highlands Medical have partnered up to offer free COVID-19 drive through testing on Wednesday, May 13, in Forsyth County. Be sure to call the number below and schedule an appointment prior to arrival: https://t.co/i6Lah4HbFp

Georgia nonprofits that offer humanities programming can now apply for COVID-related relief through Georgia Humanities. Click below to learn more:
https://t.co/LgXikhbzDs

Happy Mother's Day to all the Moms here in #GA07! Over the past few months, you have gone above and beyond to meet the incredible challenges posed by the pandemic. You deserve to be celebrated today and everyday.

When he’s not working at Northside Hospital, Ryan Hepworth spends his time supporting homeless veterans throughout metro Atlanta.
 
Ryan is a great example of what makes our part of the world so special, and I thank him for his service to our neighbors. https://t.co/0F7zVva5ZQ

In response to the COVID-19 outbreak, the three big national credit reporting agencies are now offering free weekly credit reports to all Americans for the next year. Click the link below to get started:
https://t.co/3jVdesfMfQ

https://t.co/3jVdesfMfQ

United Way of Greater Atlanta and Community Foundation for Greater Atlanta have committed $1.5 million to support those most vulnerable to the economic and health-related impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. Click below to learn more:
https://t.co/eLus4carwi

You can now play “bingo” to help support local Forsyth restaurants that have been struggling through the current pandemic. 
 
Click the link below for more information on how to get started:
https://t.co/1RbygtTgqT

Thank you to the Boys and Girls Club of Metro Atlanta for arranging a comprehensive resource page for anyone in need of assistance during the COVID-19 pandemic.  Click below to find the organizations that can help you best:
https://t.co/K4v5TzTY7A

National Guard members in Cumming have begun disinfecting long-term care facilities to help protect vulnerable Georgians.
 
Thank you to all these men and women who are risking their health to keep our community safe and stopping the spread of COVID-19.
https://t.co/f8CuPVhNGM

I would like to thank the ⁦@GwinnettChamber⁩ for hosting yesterday’s webinar on the local, state, and federal response to the COVID-19 outbreak.
 
If you were unable to join us, you can view our informative discussion below: https://t.co/6I6GJnwnVm

If you’re looking to get tested for COVID-19, CVS has a new test site near GA Tech that will provide same day results.
 
To get started, you will need to pre-register on the website. Click below for more information:
https://t.co/vXV6c9qob4

ICYMI: For the past few weeks, I have discussed many of the concerns that have been raised about COVID-19 in my weekly e-newsletters. I hope you will take a moment to read about some of the most recent efforts to address this threat and lessen its impact: https://t.co/L0Fi7aPPem

Suwanee medical students have joined together to offer free grocery service for the elderly and medically isolated individuals. This is yet another incredible example of #GA07 residents going above and beyond to lend a helping hand during this pandemic. https://t.co/s3qrFN45G3

Volunteers in #GA07 have sewed thousands of medical masks and delivered them to local clinics and hospitals to address the current shortage. It’s incredible to see our community unite during these turbulent times and do what is takes to help those in need.https://t.co/5Oo2OWRVpS

Despite being a difficult time for the industry, restaurants across #GA07 have come together to take care of our health care professionals. These are incredible acts of kindness, and they go a long way to helping our community combat the spread of COVID-19.https://t.co/7z9cypksV6

Today on #NationalDoctorsDay, it’s important to recognize the strength and hard work of all our health care professionals who are doing everything possible to care for our friends, neighbors, and loved ones during this pandemic.
 
I thank you for your dedicated service. https://t.co/bjExQKCP7a

Emergency loans are now available for Georgia small businesses impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. Click below for more information:
https://t.co/4W4fkeGIJd
If you believe that you are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19 or have been exposed to the virus, you can now call Georgia’s new hotline number with any questions or concerns: https://t.co/LWtxUHmAxg

Yesterday, President Trump presented his Coronavirus Guidelines for America. I encourage you to read through the steps you can take to reduce the spread of COVID-19. You can also check back here or visit my website for any updates on the virus https://t.co/0o36sa33he
RT @CDCgov: Everyone can help prevent the spread of #COVID19. Practice healthy habits like avoiding close contact with people who are sick.…

RT @GovKemp: Please continue to share the following @CDCgov information on #COVID19 with your friends, family, and co-workers >>> 
@GaDPH @…

Today, the House passed a bipartisan funding bill to help combat the coronavirus. 

These funds will help to expedite vaccine development, procure necessary equipment and hospital supplies, and help local authorities directly address the outbreak.

Read the current COVID-19 testing protocols if you think you’ve been exposed, and call your doctor before you go to the hospital to prevent further disease spread. I’ll share more CDC-approved info as we get it. https://t.co/eFK3oR3Ooi

The CDC has urged Americans to institute normal procedures for preventing disease, including regular hand washing. Visit the CDC’s website for information about how to stay safe. https://t.co/uYs2dbGGhZ

(1/2) Eighty years after the @MarchofDimes was created to save lives during the polio epidemic, the organization is forced to choose whether to help its employees retire with dignity and financial security or continue its core mission in service to others.

On the 1st International Whole Grains Day, I would like to recognize @GeneralMills — an important company to us here in #Georgia — for their efforts to demonstrate the healthful benefits of incorporating whole grains into our diet #ChooseWholeGrains #InternationalWGDay @Cheerios

In #GA07, @SharonElemS has dedicated 20% of its grounds to ecological use including an outdoor classroom & containment pond. Thank you for protecting the health of your students & the environment. 

I was honored to attend the @usedgov’s reception honoring @EDGreenRibbon schools. https://t.co/IQdgCiakZg

Today I met with representatives from the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA) @AOTAInc to discuss legislation to improve our access to mental health services and occupational therapy – an important issue that impacts many of us here in #GA07. https://t.co/j1yrlmJT5U

This week, I met with #GA07 representatives from Novo Nordisk @novonordiskus, a global healthcare company that focuses on #diabetes care.

Thank you all for stopping by to discuss ways we can reduce obesity in our community and improve patient care. https://t.co/7ULtbydsiX

Yesterday, I met with representatives from the @NationalCouncil for Behavioral Health. 

We talked about a variety of different health issues that impact #GA07, including funding for mental health services and measures to address the nation’s opioid crisis. https://t.co/1oDzqS60bA

.@GHMSINC serves over 18,750 patients in our community. Of those, 75% are living below the poverty line, & over 50% are uninsured.⁣
⁣
Georgia Highlands Medical Services has leveraged its federal investment to provide top-notch health care in #GA07. Congratulations on 40 years! https://t.co/p6M5BJFIs0

Today, @HouseBudgetGOP & @HouseBudgetDems held a hearing about the costs of #ClimateChange. 

I believe that preserving the health of our planet is something that we can all get behind; however, we must be unified and smart in the way in which we achieve this goal.

Watch below: https://t.co/L3VRXLc6E9

Fixing our nation’s broken healthcare system will not be easy. 

Last week’s decision by the Administration to rescind the proposed “Rebate Rule” exemplifies the very difficulties that ensue when such efforts are undertaken. 

Read more in my e-newsletter:
https://t.co/IoYrcV4fx8 https://t.co/D7MK6mRw9q

As most of you know, June is National Alzheimer's and Brain Awareness Month. Statistics suggest that each one of us is going to know someone or have a family member who will be affected by #Alzheimers or #brain health in one way or another.

We will not give up hope. https://t.co/f3IXyCViGZ

We are so fortunate to have health care institutions that are continually highlighted for their good work in #Forsyth. 

.@NorthsideHosp was recently recognized by Healthgrades with its Outstanding Patient Experience Award for the second consecutive year. 
https://t.co/gWfe4zf76K

.@USCBO put together a report for @HouseBudgetDems about the implications of single-payer health care, but failed to address how many trillions of dollars it would cost.
 
I spoke w/ @FOX5Atlanta’s @RussFox5 about why #MedicareForAll is not a viable health solution for #Georgia. https://t.co/qpGH1WaRaK

Earlier today, @HouseBudgetGOP and @HouseBudgetDems held a hearing with the Congressional Budget Office @USCBO to discuss its recent report on the risks of imposing a single-payer, one-size-fits-all health care system.

Watch my #MedicareForAll #M4A Q&A with the panel below: https://t.co/VG76kLAYtZ

Happening Now: @HouseBudgetGOP and @HouseBudgetDems are holding a hearing about establishing a single-payer health care system in the United States. #MedicareForAll #M4A

Click the link below to watch the hearing: 
https://t.co/KGAcHzTwBZ https://t.co/kZYA52dZwP

Yesterday, @HouseDemocrats perpetuated fiction, making it seem like #HR986 is going to stop the #Trump Administration from taking away health insurance for folks with pre-existing conditions. That’s nonsense! 

Here's the real story: 
https://t.co/nfdXXHv7x6 https://t.co/1dz3ux4zMQ

Hey @JusticeDems, Republicans and Democrats need to work together to tackle the complex issues that affect our communities. When it comes to health care, I believe that there is more that unites us than divides us. I would encourage you to highlight my full dialogue... https://t.co/4kjj5u2fJ9

Today, @RulesReps argued #MedicareForAll:

✅Takes over the health care industry
✅Requires higher taxes because it cannot pay for itself
✅Eliminates employer sponsored coverage

I raised concerns about how a one-size-fits-all #health #care system would cost taxpayers trillions. https://t.co/bWwHXScELB

#NationalPrescriptionDrugTakeBackDay provides a responsible way to dispose of excess #prescription #drugs while raising awareness about the potential for #abuse. We can work together to combat the #opioid epidemic this #TakeBackDay. Find a collection site: https://t.co/gyDV6a7fHt https://t.co/1MDyxL3tL8

#Healthcare simulators are increasingly being used to practice high-risk techniques & establish safe protocols in the name of improving patient safety. 

I had a great time visiting @GwinnettMedical's simulation lab to see how simulators are being used to do just that in #GA07! https://t.co/9f8CsUtSMB

(2) This legislation requires health care providers who are present at the live birth of a child exercise skill, care, and diligence to preserve the life of the #child—the same degree of care that would be offered to any other child #born #prematurely at the same gestational age.

In today's e-newsletter, I examine @POTUS’s budget request & discuss how @HouseGOP & @HouseDemocrats should work together to make #prescription #drugs more #affordable, eradicate the HIV/AIDS virus, & reduce burdensome regulations stifling job creation.
https://t.co/Rao7WbmNQW

For the 7th consecutive year, #ForsythCounty has been named as the healthiest county in #Georgia! The County Health Rankings Report examines a number of factors including life expectancy, access to healthy foods, and socio-economic considerations.
https://t.co/D5X33e05iq

#CommunityHealthCenters do important work for our family, friends, and neighbors.

I applaud President @realDonaldTrump's commitment to balancing our nation’s budget while reauthorizing CHCs and recognizing their importance in our community. https://t.co/iCiUlQp3LM

This is a win for everyone.

Forsyth and Gwinnett counties are made richer by our Chinese, Korean, and Vietnamese American communities. 

On behalf of #GA07, I would like to wish you and your loved ones, happiness, prosperity, and good health in the new year. 🐷

May God bless you and your family. https://t.co/JPWnB5ron2

Congratulations to Brian Kemp and Geoff Duncan on being sworn in as Georgia’s 83rd Governor and 12th Lieutenant Governor! I look forward to working with @GovKemp on economic development opportunities in #GA07, combating the opioid epidemic, & rebuilding Georgia's infrastructure. https://t.co/GL35QJdCkh

I’m very proud of the work being done to solve the #OpioidEpidemic in America. Sadly, unused Rx medication is often obtained by family, friends, or those with access, & can spur addiction. Learn more about #NationalPrescriptionDrugTakeBackDay below. https://t.co/CwSNOouQAL
This is such an important step in combating the #OpioidEpidemic, and I’m proud to see it become law. @HouseGOP @POTUS https://t.co/euYlhxG68F
Great to catch up with my friends at @GHMSINC today to celebrate #NationalHealthCenterWeek! Thank you again for all you do! #GA07 https://t.co/26WBbbM0OA

The #VAMISSIONAct was approved overwhelmingly by Congress & I’m pleased to see the @POTUS sign it into law as we strive to serve our #veterans’ healthcare needs with more access and more choices. https://t.co/lNzGiZSnDB
More excellence from #GA07! 1st and 4th healthiest counties in #Georgia! #HealthRankings https://t.co/dDBXyaLWdh
#Healthcare and other updates from #WashingtonDC last week. Read more from - and sign up for - my newsletter here. https://t.co/SgrcMg09FL
